metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20254 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in samba. The Samba smbd file server must map Windowsgroup identities (SIDs) into unix group ids (gids). The code that performsthis had a flaw that could allow it to read data beyond the end of thearray in the case where a negative cache entry had been added to themapping cache. This could cause the calling code to return those valuesinto the process token that stores the group membership for a user. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20254` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
libnss-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
libpam-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
libsmbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
libwbclient0 - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
python3-samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
registry-tools - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-common - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-common-bin - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-libs - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-testsuite - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
smbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.8').
